title: conferred on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) 

(Amendment) (No. 2) Order 2021. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 16 June 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited immigration act 2004 (visas) (amendment) (no 2) order 2021 (2) order come operation 16 june 2021

title: conferred on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as
heading: 2. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is
text_raw:
2. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is 

amended – 

(a) 

in Schedule 1, by the insertion of – 

(i) 

“Argentina” after “Antigua and Barbuda”, 

(ii) 

“Bolivia” after “Belize”, 

(iii) “Brazil” after “Botswana”, 

(iv) “Chile” after “Canada”, 

(v) 

“Guyana” after “Guatemala”, 

(vi) “Paraguay” after “Panama”, 

(vii) “South Africa” after “Solomon Islands”, and 

(viii) “Uruguay” after “United States of America”, and 

(b) 

in Schedule 5, by the deletion of “Argentina”, “Bolivia”, “Brazil”, 
“Chile”, “Columbia”, “Ecuador”, “Guyana”, “Paraguay”, “Peru”, 
“South Africa”, “Suriname” and “Uruguay”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 June, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 18th June, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [287] 3

title: conferred on me by section 17 of the Immigration Act 2004 (No. 1 of 2004) (as
heading: (This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order further amends Schedules 1 and 5 to the Immigration Act 2004 
(Visas) Order 2014. The Order provides that nationals of Argentina, Bolivia, 
Brazil, Chile, Guyana, Paraguay, South Africa and Uruguay are not required to 
be in possession of a valid Irish visa when landing in the State. The Order also 
provides that nationals of Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Columbia, Ecuador, 
Guyana, Paraguay, Peru, South Africa, Suriname, and Uruguay are not required 
to be in possession of a valid Irish transit visa when arriving at a port in the State 
for purposes of passing through the port in order to travel to another state. The 
Order has 
the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) 
(Amendment) Order 2021 (S.I. No. 23 of 2021).
